detaileddescription.para: Species identificator
Species sequence
Total Number of molecules (charged + unchurged) belonging to this species
Number of charged molecules
Concentration of the species
Species age (computed from the last creation)
Number of times that the species became greater than zero
Diffusion initialization parameter
Solubility parameter Threshold: 1 soluble - 0 precipitated (this species will not be avalaible for reactions)
Complex degradation rate (If the species is not a complex this value is set to 0)
Binding point in case of complex (3 means for example that ABBAA could be formed by a catalyst AAB and a substrate AA)
Boolean variable that indicates the state of the species (1: already evaluated, 0: virtual)
If the species is a complex this is the ID of the catalyst
If the species is a complex this is the ID of the substrate
Energy Phosphorilation kinetic constant associated with each species
This parameter indicates whether the species is energizable or not
This parameter indicates whether or not the species concentration may change
Concentration at the beginning of the simulation, > 0 for the initial species, 0 otherwise
ID of the last species evaluated by this species for possible reactions
If the species in a complex this is a list of the second substrates with which perform the final condensation
Catalysis ID list if complex
List parallel to secondSubstrates, contain a copy of the k condensation
This class containing the declaration of the species.

class species
Alessandro Filisetti

memberdef.name: species

detaileddescription.para: This constructor is used each time a new species is created (AMOUNT BASED)

parameterdescription.para: 1 if the species is soluble, 0 otherwise
This parameter indicates whether the species has been already evalutad (i.e. all the catalysis of the species are instantiated)
the volume is necessary to convert numbers in concentrations
phosphorilation kinetic constant (in case of energy based simulations)
this is a flag indicating whether or not the species is energizable
